meanings.sent1: The leech attached itself to the skin and started feeding.
meanings.sent2: Doctors sometimes use leeches in medical treatments.
meanings.sent3: The leech thought it found an all-you-can-eat buffet on my leg!
meanings.sent4: Her constant borrowing money from me made her a financial leech.
meanings.sent5: The leech's ability to suck blood is both fascinating and creepy.

meanings.definition: To cling to or exploit someone or something for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: He tends to leech off his friends for free meals.
meanings.sent2: Some people leech off the hard work of others.
meanings.sent3: Stop trying to leech all the credit for our group project!
meanings.sent4: Her negative attitude seemed to leech the joy out of the room.
meanings.sent5: The company's success was leeching off the innovative ideas of its employees.

meanings.definition: A person who is dependent on others and gives little in return.
meanings.sent1: She's a leech, always asking for help but never offering any in return.
meanings.sent2: Beware of becoming a leech in your relationships.
meanings.sent3: The leech at the office always takes credit for our team's work.
meanings.sent4: His laziness made him a leech on society.
meanings.sent5: The leech's selfish behavior drained the goodwill of those around him.
